sen.j: 河鰭 実文（かわばた さねふみ、弘化2年4月5日 (旧暦)（1845年5月10日） - 明治43年（1910年）7月16日）は、幕末から明治時代にかけての公家・政治家。
sen.e: Sanefumi KAWABATA (May 10, 1845 – July 16, 1910) was a court noble and a statesman active in the period since the end of the Edo period until the Meiji era.

sen.j: 内大臣三条実万の子で、土佐藩主山内豊策の娘紀子。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (minister of the center) Sanetsumu SANJO; his mother was Noriko (or Kishi), a daughter of the lord of Tosa Domain Toyokazu YAMAUCHI.

sen.j: 近衛府河鰭公述の養子縁組となり、河鰭家第25代当主となる。
sen.e: He was adopted by Konoefu (inner palace guard) Kinakira KAWABATA and he became the 25th family head of the Kawabata family.

sen.e: Kinmutsu SANJO and Sanetomi SANJO were his brothers; Kazuhime who was engaged to Toyoatsu YAMAUCHI, and Mine who was the lawful wife of Yoshikuni HOSOKAWA, were his sisters.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争では錦旗奉行となり、慶応4年（1868年）4月には有栖川宮熾仁親王に従って江戸城に入った。
sen.e: In the Boshin War, he served at Nishikinohata Bugyo (magistrate in charge of taking care of the imperial banners), and in April of 1868, he entered the Edo-jo Castle attending Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Taruhito.

sen.e: In 1870, he became Tokyo-fu Gonnosho Sanji (junior councilor of Tokyo Prefecture), later held important posts such as Naimu Gonnosho Shokikan (junior secretary of the department of home affair).

sen.e: In 1873, he went to England and studied; after coming home, he became Kazoku-kaikan Fukukanji (assistant secretary of the Nobility Hall).
